title: Convert to multi-page navigation structure with 6 separate pages

requirements.summary: Implement React Router for multi-page navigation structure with routes for 6 separate pages
acceptanceCriteria: Each page has its own route and URL
Browser back/forward buttons work correctly
Navigation maintains consistent theme across pages

file_operations.description: Replace single-page layout with React Router setup including BrowserRouter, Routes, and Route components for all 6 pages (/, /memories, /understanding, /one-chance, /question, /final). Remove existing section components from App.tsx as they will be reorganized into separate page components.
Create Landing page component that will render at route /. This component will integrate the HeroSection component and provide navigation to the Memories page.
Create Memories page component that will render at route /memories. This component will integrate the GallerySection component and provide Back/Next navigation buttons.
Create Understanding page component that will render at route /understanding. This component will integrate the UnderstandingSection component and provide Back/Next navigation buttons.
Create One Chance page component that will render at route /one-chance. This component will integrate the ActionButtonsSection component and provide Next navigation button.
Create Cute Game page component that will render at route /question. This component will integrate the QuestionSection component and provide Next navigation button to the final page.
Create Final page component that will render at route /final. This component will integrate the ClosingSection component with no navigation buttons as this is the terminal page.

Create Layout wrapper component that applies consistent theme elements (background, floating hearts animation, container styling) to all pages. This component will wrap page content and ensure consistent spacing, centering, and responsive behavior across all routes.
Wrap all Route components with the Layout component to ensure consistent theme application across all pages.
Add custom Tailwind configuration for pastel pink color variants, golden glow utilities, and ensure responsive breakpoints are properly configured for mobile-friendly design.

requirements.summary: Refactor existing section components to work within the new multi-page structure
acceptanceCriteria: Existing section components are reused in appropriate page components
No duplication of logic or styling
All interactive features continue to work correctly

file_operations.description: Refactor HeroSection to be a pure presentational component that accepts props for heading and subtext, removing any navigation logic to be handled by the parent LandingPage component.
Refactor GallerySection to accept image paths and captions as props, making it reusable and decoupled from specific page logic.
Refactor UnderstandingSection to accept text content as props or keep static content, ensuring it's a pure presentational component without navigation concerns.
Refactor ActionButtonsSection to accept button labels and click handlers as props, removing hardcoded navigation to make it reusable across different contexts.
Refactor QuestionSection to accept onYesClick callback prop for triggering heart animation, maintaining existing interactive features (moving No button) while decoupling animation logic.
Refactor ClosingSection to accept heading and subtext as props or keep static content, ensuring it's a pure presentational component with glowing text effect styling.

file_operations.description: Create placeholder file for first memory gallery image. Reference the generated image at frontend/public/assets/generated/memory-1.dim_600x600.jpg as the initial placeholder content. Users can replace this file with their own photo without code changes.

Create placeholder file for second memory gallery image. Reference the generated image at frontend/public/assets/generated/memory-2.dim_600x600.jpg as the initial placeholder content. Users can replace this file with their own photo without code changes.

Create placeholder file for third memory gallery image. Reference the generated image at frontend/public/assets/generated/memory-3.dim_600x600.jpg as the initial placeholder content. Users can replace this file with their own photo without code changes.

Update GallerySection to reference placeholder images using paths /assets/memory-1.jpg, /assets/memory-2.jpg, and /assets/memory-3.jpg. Include comments in the code explaining that users can replace these files in frontend/public/assets directory.

Create README documentation explaining how to replace placeholder images in frontend/public/assets directory. Include clear instructions: 1) Navigate to frontend/public/assets, 2) Replace memory-1.jpg, memory-2.jpg, memory-3.jpg with your own photos, 3) Keep the same filenames, 4) Recommended dimensions are 600x600px for best display.
